You run as fast as you can, hoping that oncethe mother sees her baby is safe, she will notpursue you. You dart into a cavern. It's darker and hotterthan the pleasant spot where you found the fledg-ling. Is it the same passageway you camethrough? Still running, you look back over your shoulderto see if the mother bird is following. At thatmoment you find yourself falling, or rather rising,toward the earth's surfaceâ€”drawn up into whatmust be the same shaft that forms the BottomlessCrevasse! Soon you stop rising and start falling. Then yourise a shorter distance, stop, and begin to fallagain. You feel like a yo-yo, bouncing up anddown, up and down, until you finally come to restat the center of gravity, the point where you willneither rise nor fall. Like a cork thrown in theocean, you seem doomed to drift forever

The End
